taskbody.context: If a property group is not applicable to a route or an operation, you can remove it. When you do so, the property group and the underlying properties are unassigned from the route or operation, but they are not deleted from the database.

step.cmd: In the Route Management page, select the route from which you want to remove a property group.

step.stepresult: A list of property groups assigned to the route appear.If you want to access a list of property groups that are assigned only to an operation, select the operation.

step.cmd: In the row containing the property group that you want to remove, select .
step.stepresult: A message appears, asking you to confirm that you want to remove the property group.

The property group and the underlying properties are removed from the route or operation.If the property group has been assigned to the route, when you remove it, it is removed from all the operations of the route.
